sentences.sContent: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.sCn: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

sentences.sContent: ...These extra features are deemed unnecessary by the majority of shoppers...
...The majority of previous research has focused on how we learn and remember new information...
...Now that women are the majority of college students and surpass men in both the number of undergraduate and advanced degrees awarded...
...The high cost of steam and the lesser need for speed kept the majority of the world's ocean freight moving by sail until the early years of the 20th century...
...excessive packaging can make the majority of merchants get high profit for the cheap commodity by improving price...

phrases.pCn: 过半数；一般多数， 简单多数
沉默的大多数（持温和观点并很少发表意见者）

words.tran: 主要的；重要的；主修的；较多的
[人类] 成年人；主修科目；陆军少校

trans.tranOther: most of the people or things in a group
